channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Ronnie Wood, 73, the rock maestro exhibits original artworks with all profits going to the NHS
item.description: Rolling Stones guitarist has teamed up with Ashridge House in Hertfordshire to unveil a collection of new artworks - with all the money made from ticket sales to be donated to the NHS.

item.title: Victoria records 216 new cases of coronavirus overnight
item.description: A family-of-four who scientists inadvertently sparked Victoria's second wave were allowed to walk around their hotel.

item.title: Party organiser says she just invited 20 people to her lockdown breach rave in Manchester
item.description: Charlene Proham, 27, was slapped with a £100 fine and banned from having anyone in her house for three months after she was identified as the organiser of an illegal rave in Gorton, Manchester, on August 15.

item.title: Honey 'beats antibiotics' for curing colds: Study shows it's more effective than medication
item.description: Experts at Oxford University found that honey reduced the frequency of coughs by 36 per cent, and cut the severity of coughs by 44 per cent.

item.title: Bill Clinton tears into Donald Trump accusing him of spending 'hours a day watching TV'
item.description: Bill Clinton directly attacked President Donald Trump as incapable of doing the job, accusing him of spending hours a day watching TV and playing around on social media.

item.title: Donald Trump's fawning letters with Russian strongman Vladimir Putin revealed
item.description: The Senate Intel Committee's report on Russia included copies of letter Donald Trump wrote to Russia's Vladimir Putin, including one referencing 'BEAUTIFUL WOMEN!'

item.title: How to shock proof your finances: Protect your family from recession
item.description: Covid-19 has disrupted all of our lives. Our working lives, social lives and family lives were all thrown up in the air back in March when the unprecedented lockdown was announced.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'will DEFY calls for autumn reshuffle' despite Tory pressure to sack Gavin Williamson
item.description: The PM has been accused of having a 'lack of grip' after a series of mishaps during the coronavirus crisis have left the UK Government being 'laughed at'.

item.title: Victoria Beckham refutes claims of negligence at her fashion house
item.description: Victoria Beckham has hit back at claims of negligence at her fashion company after it was revealed that a former pattern cutter was taking legal action against her.

item.title: What a personal trainer eats to stay lean: Expert Rachel Dillon shares her EXACT daily diet
item.description: Personal trainer Rachel Dillon, from Queensland, has revealed the meals she eats each day to keep her in shape and 'maintain' her current figure - and why you need to eat more if fat loss is your goal.

item.title: Universities demand Government money to cope with U-turn chaos
item.description: British universities have asked for extra financial help so they can 'scale up' places for the 2020 and 2021 intake, a source said.

item.title: Mutinous troops in Mali seize country's president and several government ministers
item.description: Malian President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita, 75, announced his resignation on the country's national broadcaster ORTM, hours after he was seized by mutinous soldiers in the capital Bamako.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Government's exams fiasco
item.description: 'It's a new algorithm to calculate how long before you lose your job, minister'

item.title: It's claimed the Duke of Sussex called the Queen's most trusted confidante 'this woman'
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Two days ago, it was reported that Prince Harry had raised his voice with the Queen after a row with Angela Kelly over which tiara Meghan would wear when the couple wed....

item.title: Oldham 'is 48 hours away' from even harsher Leicester-style lockdown with pubs and restaurants shut
item.description: The Government is expected to decide whether to order the closure of the Greater Manchester town's bars, restaurants and gyms on Thursday.

item.title: Migrant in his 20s is attacked moments after coming ashore in a dinghy on a Kent beach
item.description: The man, thought to be in his 20s and from the Middle East, was set upon by an unknown assailant who watched the boat arrive on the beach near Deal.

item.title: ROSS CLARK: The exams fiasco is proof that we can't trust algorithms to rule our lives
item.description: ROSS CLARK: You could be forgiven if, until this week, you'd never heard of the word 'algorithm'. Anyone who can both spell the word and come up with a concise definition deserves an 'A' in maths.

item.title: Diners have eaten more than 35million Eat Out To Help Out meals in Rishi Sunak's half-price scheme
item.description: The Paddock Inn near Tenby, Pembrokeshire, says revellers taking advantage of the widely-popular scheme have shown 'extreme levels of rudeness' and caused staff 'nothing but grief'.

item.title: GUY ADAMS: Why on earth are Ofqual's CEO and chairman still in a job today?
item.description: GUY ADAMS: Under Sally Collier's stewardship, Ofqual has just presided over the most appalling farce in the history of Britain's education system.

item.title: Madonna has resorted to ever more desperate cries for attention during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Madonna's briefings, from her £6 million house in Lisbon, to her 15.4 million followers on Instagram have included posing with a joint on holiday in Jamaica and a physio session with her beau.

item.title: Sources hit back over 'nonsense' claims of Prince Charles' 'hot and cold' relationship with sons
item.description: Claims of a relationship breakdown between The Prince of Wales and his two sons have been dismissed as 'complete nonsense' by royal sources, according to The Mirror.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Don't dare to blame childless women for the social care crisis
item.description: SARAH VINE: According to new official figures, my generation of women has levels of childlessness similar to those whose chances of a family were wrecked by World War II...

item.title: 'Oh dahling'! Duchess of Sussex uses Britishisms after spending two years in the UK, it is claimed
item.description: Sources working in the Duke and Duchess's £11million mansion in Santa Barbara, California, said Meghan regularly uses certain very British words.

item.title: Sport of the future: 13-year-old girl invents the 'Electrodeck' remote-control skateboard
item.description: Charlotte Geary, from Bournemouth, presented her invention to judges including cycling champion Mark Cavendish as part of the IET Sports of the Future competition.

item.title: Man convicted in the murder of Michael Jordan's father in 1993 is granted parole
item.description: Larry M. Demery, 45, was granted parole on Tuesday and will be freed on August 6, 2023, The N.C. Post-Release Supervision and Parole Commission announced.

item.title: Heathrow Airport unveils plan to spare passengers by screening for Covid-19 as flights arrive
item.description: It is hoped that Heathrow's new multi-million pound Covid detection area will bring an end to the UK's 14-day quarantine rule that is destroying the travel industry.

item.title: PSG fans sprayed with tear gas by baton-wielding riot police in Paris
item.description: Police have clashed with PSG fans on the streets of Paris following their win over RB Leipzig, which booked their spot in the Champions League final. Thousands of people congregated in the city.

item.title: Drive hands-free on the motorway IN MONTHS: Ministers draw up plans to approve 'lane-keeping' tech
item.description: Ministers are examining whether vehicles fitted with an Automated Lane Keeping System (ALKS) should be allowed to use it at speeds of up to 70mph on some of the country's busiest roads.

item.title: Sam Faiers reveals she has secretly battled cystic acne for two years
item.description: The reality star, 29, has spoken out about her secret battle with cystic acne.

item.title: Health bodies demand fix for social care crisis as elderly patients could face even longer waits
item.description: Fifteen medical bodies say the system urgently needs reformed. They are 'gravely concerned' about the ability of social care services to cope with second wave of coronavirus in the winter.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND argues M&S's decline extends way beyond coronavirus lockdown
item.description: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Even the thought of the High Street without Marks & Spencer is too awful to contemplate. More than a mere shop, it is part of the warp and weft, the fabric of our lives.

item.title: Premature baby born in lockdown helps his father propose to his mother
item.description: Mother Sian Stafford, 26, was concentrating so much on newborn son Cobie that she initially missed the ring and note reading: 'Mummy, will you marry daddy?'. He was born in Nottinghamshire.
item.media:description: John Sellors put an engagement ring and a note inside his newborn son´s incubator (Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust/PA)

item.title: Mum sparks heated debate over the 'correct' way to peg washing on a clothes line
item.description: The debate started when a mother posted a picture in an Australian cleaning group on Facebook, which shows a towel draped over a line and pinned along the side - not across the top, as is customary.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Robert Tchenguiz risks £27m gamble on spreadbet
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Details of Tchenguiz's audacious gamble are revealed in a document which he's just submitted to the High Court in his battle against CMC Spreadbet...

item.title: Cindy McCain video on Joe Biden to air at DNC
item.description: Cindy McCain will speak for Joe Biden at the Democratic National Convention, lending her voice to a video tribute to Biden's friendship with her late husband, Republican Senator John McCain.

item.title: Pizza Express to shut 73 restaurants
item.description: The company, which currently has around 454 restaurants in the UK, said on Tuesday it has finalised a proposal to reduce its restaurant and rental costs via a company voluntary arrangement.
item.media:description: Up to 1,100 jobs could go at Pizza Express as it announced plans to shut 73 stores (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: Chariots Of Fire and Star Trek actor Ben Cross dies aged 72 after a short illness
item.description: Chariots Of Fire star Ben Cross has died aged 72 after a short illness.

item.title: Donald Trump opens Arizona mini-rally by accusing Joe Biden and Barack Obama of TREASON
item.description: Donald Trump came out guns blazing at a mini rally in Arizona accusing former President Barack Obama and presumed Democratic nominee Joe Biden of 'treason' in his first sentence.

item.title: Stripes and checked patterns repel horseflies
item.description: There's nothing which ruins a picnic quicker than a swarm of flies joining the feast. But now, experts have discovered a simple solution to this all-too-familiar plague: Sit on a checked picnic blanket.

item.title: Pregnant women with high blood pressure at greater risk of suffering hot flushes during menopause
item.description: A link has been found between hot flushes during menopause and high blood pressure in pregnancy, US study suggests. Up to 10% of pregnant women in the UK suffer high blood pressure.

item.title: Ken Dodd's widow Lady Anne donates £700,000 to build an amphitheatre in Prescot
item.description: The 'performance garden' will open in Prescot in 2022 after Sir Ken Dodd's widow Lady Anne Dodd offered to meet the costs of the build.

item.title: London and Cardiff raked in £58.2m from moving traffic offences
item.description: More than half of the fines were from yellow-box junction infringements in the financial year 2018/19, which continue to prove lucrative for authorities across both capitals.

item.title: Environment bill to include legally binding targets to curb plastic waste and air pollution
item.description: The environment Bill will form part of the prime minister's bid to 'build back greener', and will focus on less waste, cleaner air, cleaner water and more biodiversity to tackle climate change.

item.title: Top civil servant at Department for Education 'is facing axe' over series of school disasters
item.description: Jonathan Slater's future at the Department for Education is reportedly in question. Ministers are said to be concerned about recent failures to reopen schools before the summer and exam grades.

item.title: SpaceX Raptor engine breaks pressure chamber record
item.description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk announced on Twitter that the Raptor engine did not explode after reaching a new high combustion chamber pressure of 330 bar during a controlled burn test.

item.title: Goat with prosthetic limbs is surrogate mother to triplet kids
item.description: Anna the goat lost her hind legs and large parts of her front legs to frost bite when she was born in an arctic freeze on a farm in 2015. Now, she is part of loving home in Pennsylvania, with four new legs.

item.title: Megayachts avoid coronavirus-stricken Spain and opt for up-and-coming Croatia and Turkey
item.description: At least 63 mega-yachts are sailing off the coast of Turkey, more than double the 26 that were there this time last year. Croatia is now host to 64 - up from just 45 this time last year.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'pitch secret Hollywood project'
item.description: Sources say that the former royal couple began pitching their idea to 'numerous' media companies back in June, around the time that they purchased a sprawling estate in Santa Barbara.

item.title: That should cure my ass-thma! Donkey with chronic breathing problems gets specially-made 'inhaler'
item.description: Rescue donkey Marla (pictured), who lives at the Flicka Foundation in Penryn, Cornwall - has a specially-made 'inhaler' that should give her the chance to live in comfort.

item.title: Carnival hit by ransomware attack: Hackers steal passenger information
item.description: Carnival said the hackers, who targeted one particular Carnival brand, downloaded files which could 'result in potential claims from guests, employees, shareholders, or regulatory agencies'.

item.title: Microsoft announces it is ending support for Internet Explorer in 2021
item.description: Microsoft announced it is pulling the plug on its 25-year-old Internet Explorer on August 17, 2021. The tech giant will urge users to update to its Chromium-based Edge prior to removing it.

item.title: Federal study will test combination of remdesivir and multiple sclerosis in coronavirus patients
item.description: Beta interferon is a drug approved to treat multiple sclerosis, has anti-inflammatory properties and has been shown to stop replication of viruses like SARS, and will be tested with remdesivir.

item.title: Build a recession war chest: Where should you put your lockdown loot?
item.description: Around two in five of us managed to save more in lockdown after a large chunk of our day-to-day expenses disappeared. British savers amassed £66bn over four months this year.

item.title: Hundred-year-old photos show how treeline has crept up the Rockies due to climate change
item.description: Scientists compared areas of the Canadian Rockies with photos taken by mountaineers over the past century to see how much the landscape has changed due to climate change.

item.title: Patch up your pension: Experts explain how to repair the Covid damage
item.description: Savers, who were set to retire, may have had to reconsider as pension pots saw their worst quarterly performance on record in the first three months of 2020, when the average fund lost 15.2 per cent.

item.title: Elon Musk is now the fourth richest person in the world after gaining $8BILLION in one day
item.description: Tesla's stock jumped 11 percent on Monday, and Musk's net worth rose to $84.8 billion, making him the fourth richest person in the world, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

item.title: British Airways' 747 retirement plan starts at Heathrow Airport
item.description: The aircraft, flying under flight number BA9170E, was pictured taking to the skies around 10.30am bound for Castellon in Spain, after more than 25 years of flying.

item.title: Injured cow is air-lifted to lower ground in the Swiss Alps
item.description: Today, around 1,000 cows were ushered down the hills at the Klausen Pass in Switzerland but one, which had suffered a minor injury, was transported downhill by a helicopter instead.

item.title: Student, 19, who twice defaced statue of Lord Nelson to 'start a debate' about slavery spared jail
item.description: Jae Ikhera, 19, had sprayed a 'V for Vendetta' anarchist symbol and blacked out the face of the national hero (pictured) in the grounds of Norwich Cathedral.

item.title: Moment ultra-rare all-white killer whale is spotted for the first time off the coast of Alaska
item.description: A rare white killer whale was spotted August 7 by researchers and whale watchers aboard the Northern Song off the coast of Kuiu and Kupreanof Islands near of Petersburg, Alaska.

item.title: Madonna sings and dances with her children at her mask-free 62nd birthday bash in Jamaica
item.description: The Queen of Pop didn't let her hip injury keep her from showing off her moves

item.title: Life on the Farm: 'Britain's loneliest shepherdess' has first baby
item.description: BBC2 documentary This Farming life has given a glimpse into the life of Britain's youngest solo shepherdess Emma Gray, who last year became a mother for the first time to her son Len.

item.title: Contagious droplets can spread more than 16 FEET from a patient infected with coronavirus
item.description: The simulation from the University of Toronot found fluorescent droplets on the examiner's hair chest, shoulders, arms and hands as well as the floor, walls, and window covers of the room

item.title: I love my boys more than life itself, but I've been so full of despair
item.description: HENRIETTA SPINK: Watching your beautiful son beat his head against the kitchen wall in fury and frustration is almost unbearable.

item.title: Chopard co-owner accused of being the 'Ghislaine Maxwell' of the jewelry world
item.description: Desiree Gallas, a former PR representative for Chopard, has alleged her boss Caroline Scheufele would offer herself up sexually to wealthy men and implied she should do the same.

item.title: 'North Korea has up to SIXTY nuclear bombs and 5,000 tons of chemical weapons', US report claims
item.description: In the report, entitled 'North Korean tactics', published last month, the US Army said it was unlikely the country would ever give up its stockpile of chemical and nuclear weapons.

item.title: New Cuba Gooding Jr. accuser claims the actor raped her in 2013
item.description: The actor is already on trial on six groping charges relating to three alleged incidents in New York between 2018 and 2019. The new woman claims he raped her in The Mercer Hotel in Manhattan.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES watches Gavin Williamson's attempts to explain away the exams chaos
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: His brutal morning tour of the broadcast studios, a very public thrashing which lasted just over an hour, was a study in political ineptitude. A masterclass in ministerial feebleness.

item.title: President Xi Jinping is facing widespread opposition within his Communist Party, insider claims
item.description: Cai Xia, a retired professor in democratic politics, made the remarks after being expelled from the Chinese Communist Party for allegedly calling Xi a 'mafia boss' and his party a 'political zombie'.

item.title: Revellers enjoy a relaxing soak as they cruise along the River Thames in a floating HOT TUB
item.description: Four people enjoyed drinks and snacks in a red hot tub this afternoon as they gently sailed past Canary Wharf in central London while bathing in toasty 100F (38C) waters.

item.title: Coronavirus: Female leaders saved lives acting 'decisively'
item.description: Female leaders such as New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern achieved 'systematically and significantly better' outcomes for their citizens amid coronavirus, research has suggested.

item.title: Grieving relatives carry coffins of two brothers at their funeral after they drowned in the sea
item.description: Muhammad Azhar Shabbir (pictured), 18, and brother Ali Athar, 16, are believed to have been trapped by the tide after walking a mile down the beach at Lytham St Anne's on the coast of Lancashire.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg eats ice cream while wearing suit in Weymouth
item.description: The Conservative MP for East Somerset was dressed in a sharp double-breasted suit as he visited Weymouth and was joined by the similarly-dapper MP for South Dorset, Richard Drax.

item.title: Coronavirus triggers inflammatory condition MIS-C in children
item.description: Researchers at King's College London discovered the illness, known as multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C), is unique and different to COVID-19 and Kawasaki Disease.

item.title: SpaceX launches dozens more Starlink satellites in record-breaking Falcon 9 rocket launch
item.description: SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket launched 58 Starlink satellites and three SkySat observational satellites owned by Planet Labs Tuesday morning, marking the company's 100th successful launch.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths fall to ANOTHER low: Flu and pneumonia is now killing six times more people
item.description: Latest data from the Office for National Statistics revealed flu and pneumonia killed 1,013 people in England and Wales in the week up to August 7, compared to 152 Covid-19 victims.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres blames introversion for 'mean' behavior in call
item.description: While Ellen, 62, is said to have spoken about some major changes in leadership in a bid to salvage the show, she also addressed rumors of her own alleged bad behavior.

item.title: NASA tracks 'dent' in Earth's magnetic field caused by solar storms which could knock out computers
item.description: NASA observed the South Atlantic Anomaly is expanding and weakening, along with splitting into two lobes that create a 'dent' in Earth's magnetic field, which could impact technologies on our planet.

item.title: London homeowner to sue neighbour for 'revenge' fly-tipping
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: A homeowner has hit back at claims he fly-tipped in his wealthy neighbour's garden in Hounslow. Gurvindher Singh Luthra has threatened to sue his neighbour.

item.title: Bill Clinton's neck massaged by Jeffrey Epstein victim in photo
item.description: Bill Clinton is seen in photos sitting comfortably and smiling as Chauntae Davies, 22, rubs her hands into his shoulders. They were on a trip with Jeffrey Epstein to Africa in September of 2002.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO says planet 'nowhere near' herd immunity
item.description: Dr Michael Ryan, the no-nonsense Irish epidemiologist in charge of the WHO's health emergencies programme, told people to stop pinning their hopes on the theory as a Covid fix-all.

item.title: Thug who pushed female police officer during protest in Parliament Square jailed for two years
item.description: Jamie Dewing, 31, pushed a female police officer down a flight steps in Parliament Square on June 13, leaving her seriously injured. He pleaded guilty and has been jailed for two years.

item.title: Council shuts down Blackburn restaurant where police broke up 100-strong wedding reception
item.description: Waheed's Buffet and Banqueting Hall in Blackburn, Lancashire, was condemned by police for a 'significant breach' of lockdown restrictions after a wedding reception was reported on Sunday.

item.title: 75% US dementia sufferers on drugs not made for the disease
item.description: A new study from the University of Michigan found antidepressants were the most common with about 50% receiving one prescription, likely to treat symptoms such as apathy and withdrawal.

item.title: Swiss town is covered in CHOCOLATE after malfunction at Lindt factory
item.description: The Lindt & Spruengli company confirmed local reports Tuesday that there was a minor defect in the cooling ventilation for a line for roasted "cocoa nibs" in its factory in Olten.

item.title: Roald Dahl fans are furious as campaigners force Sainsbury's to remove Matilda mugs from sale
item.description: Campaigners have accused the Miss Trunchbull-style mug of being 'hugely problematic' and encouraging domestic violence. But Roald Dahl fans have said this is 'idiocy'.

item.title: Government AXE PHE and replace it with new institute run by former jockey Baroness Dido Harding
item.description: Baroness Dido Harding, a former Talk Talk chief executive and head of the UK's disastrous contact tracing scheme, was today appointed interim chief of the new National Institute for Health Protection.

item.title: Tiger Woods' son Charlie steals the show at junior tournament as golf star acts as his caddy
item.description: Charlie Woods came out on top in the youth event at Hammock Creek golf course on the weekend, hitting 3-under 33 as he won by five shots in a clean round with three birdies and no bogeys.

item.title: NASA: Asteroid the size of a CAR flew less than 1,830 miles past Earth this weekend
item.description: The space rock passed over the Southern Hemisphere the same distance away from the surface of the Earth as the drive from Copenhagen, in Denmark, down to Málaga, in Spain.

item.title: People who filmed girl, 12, drown in Scottish river are slammed
item.description: The family of 12-year-old Ava Gray, who died in the River Leven in Balloch, Dunbartonshire, Scotland have criticised onlookers who filmed the search for her rather than helping the rescue effort.

item.title: Woman who practised knife fights with her jihadist brother AVOIDS jail
item.description: Sneha Chowdhury, 26, knew her brother was practising knife fighting and rehearsing beheading attacks at the family home in Luton, a trial heard. She was today handed a suspended sentence.

item.title: Civil servant defends Alex Salmond sex complaints investigation
item.description: Permanent Secretary Leslie Evans said it would have been 'unconscionable' not to investigate the complaints against Scotland's former first minister Alex Salmond.

item.title: Coronavirus could survive for LONGER in humid conditions, study finds
item.description: In an environment with high humidity - a high concentration of water vapour present in the air - these droplets travel up to 16 feet.

item.title: Police flee crowd celebrating Pakistan Independence Day
item.description: Revellers gathered in Manchester's so-called 'Curry Mile' on Friday night, in breach of the city's reinforced lockdown rules which restrict outdoor gatherings to up to six people.

item.title: Asian Brits are up to FIVE times more likely to catch coronavirus than white people
item.description: An Office for National Statistics (ONS) report released today revealed seven out of 1,510 Brits identifying as Asian swabbed positive for Covid-19 - a rate of around 0.46 per cent.

item.title: Brand new £50m motorway junction is Britain's most expensive dead end
item.description: The M49, in Bristol, South Gloucestershire, was dubbed the most expensive dead end when it was not finished by late 2019. It was meant to link a distribution park to the motorway.

item.title: Manslaughter conviction for death of actor's daughter overturned
item.description: Rapper Ceon Broughton has had his conviction for the manslaughter of his girlfriend Louella Fletcher-Michie, who died after taking the drug 2C-P at Bestival, overturned by the Court of Appeal.

item.title: 41 starved dogs reduced to just skin and bones are rescued from a Spanish farm
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: A woman has been arrested and charged with animal abuse after police discovered 41 emaciated animals being kept on a 'terrible and unhygienic' farm in Spain.

item.title: Atlantic Ocean contains 'ten times more plastic than previously thought'
item.description: Scientists examined just the uppermost surface of the Atlantic on a British research expedition and found 12 million tonnes of microplastics - plastic particles less than 5 millimetres in diameter.

item.title: Britain will be battered by high winds as some areas face up to a month's worth of rain today
item.description: Up to 1.96inches of rain could pour in just a few hours in parts of the UK today, potentially flooding homes, shutting roads and causing massive transport delays, the Met Office said.

item.title: Abandoned funfair, empty Victorian baths and disused asylum among images captured by photographer
item.description: Simon Sugden, from Bradford, has visited more than 70 abandoned sites over the past decade to photograph disused asylums, empty Victorian baths and country homes

item.title: Professor who says he's the healthiest he's ever been at 84 shares his tips for ageing well
item.description: Professor Norman Lazarus, 84, from Surrey, has no age-related diseases and is medication free. He appeared on This Morning today where he revealed his 'trinity' of tips on ageing well.

item.title: British Museum: Specialists clean lockdown grime from exhibits
item.description: More than 30 expert cleaners have been wiping off the lockdown dust from the British Museum's artefacts before the venue reopens to visitors next week.

item.title: Mother, 26, dies after being told her cervical cancer symptoms were 'normal' due to contraception
item.description: Alexandra Hodson, 26, from Kirkham, Lancashire, was diagnosed with cervical cancer in June 2018 after attending the GP with a number of health problems that were dismissed as side effects.

item.title: Royal fans spot 'paint swatches' on the wall of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's new home
item.description: Eagle-eyed royal fans noticed 'paint swatches' behind Prince Harry's, 35, shoulder during a recent video appearance, suggesting the royals may be redecorating their new home in California.

item.title: Social media users mock intelligence agency GCHQ for spelling out c-word in online Twitter puzzle
item.description: An answer to one of the Cheltenham-based agency's regular puzzles had underlined the fourth letter in the names of the planets Mercury, Venus, Uranus and Neptune.

item.title: Poldark actress Ciara Charteris, 25, says she was raped five years ago by a friend
item.description: Poldark actress Ciara Charteris has said she was raped five years ago by a close friend in a candid open letter about the experience.

item.title: Kensington mansion once home to the Maharaja of Lahore's exiled son goes on sale for £15.5m
item.description: The stunning five-bedroom property in The Little Boltons was occupied by Victor Duleep Singh, son of the last Maharaja of Lahore Sir Duleep Singh - now part of Pakistan - during the Victorian era.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand is banned from driving for six months after speeding at 85mph in his new Mercedes
item.description: Former England and Manchester United star Rio Ferdinand broke the 70mph speed limit on the A27 dual carriageway in Hove, East Sussex last year.

item.title: Teaching assistant, 28, is jailed for 32 months for having sex with pupil, 15, at Holiday Inn
item.description: Kellie Louise Smith, 28, started grooming her victim by bringing him sweets, and showering him with 'extra attention,' at his school in Coventry. She also bought him cannabis and cocaine.

item.title: Six UK National Parks for hikes, from Exmoor to Loch Lomond
item.description: There are an extraordinary 15 National Parks in the UK and they can get rather busy. Here we present six of the less famous parks that promise quieter paths and excellent places to eat and stay.

item.title: Crouchers Hotel Chichester review by the Daily Mail's Inspector
item.description: Crouchers Hotel is a 26-room property on the outskirts of Chichester. After a disappointing stay The Inspector declares that someone needs to crack the whip.

item.title: Personal trainer suing date for £130,000 after claiming she gave him a cold sore when they kissed
item.description: Martin Ashley Conway, 45, claims he has been left 'traumatised' after catching the herpes simplex cold sore virus through kissing date Jovanna Lovelace, in her 30s, in London last year.

item.title: Shoppers made two million fewer trips to the supermarket after face masks became compulsory
item.description: Footfall in stores and grocers has been steadily climbing since the peak of the pandemic, with each household currently averaging 14 trips per month.

item.title: Depression rates have DOUBLED since coronavirus hit Britain
item.description: The Office for National Statistics found 9.7 per cent of adults were depressed between July last year and March. The figure had risen to 19.2 per cent when the same group was assessed in June.

item.title: Pre-teen sips of alcohol 'could lead to binge-drinking in adolescence
item.description: Australian researchers investigated whether supply of alcohol during adolescence, either in sips or whole drinks, was associated with drinking behaviours in later life.

item.title: An address to make a splash
item.description: The sea defence, known as Grain Tower Battery, is located on a spit of land near the Isle of Grain in Kent, where the Thames and Medway meet.

item.title: Oxford-educated NHS consultant surgeon, 40, stole £5.50 throat spray from Sainsbury's
item.description: Ryan Wood, 40, was stopped by a Sainsbury's store detective after he was spotted taking a £5.50 throat spray from a shelf and placing it in his pocket at the store in Ipswich, Suffolk last year.

item.title: Chilling 'James Bond style' gadgets used by British secret agents in World War Two emerge for sale
item.description: A haul of 'James Bond style,' gadgets including miniature cameras and blades hidden in pipes, pens and pencils is set to fetch up to £3,000 when it goes up for auction this week.

item.title: Can you spot the NAKED model hiding in each of these images?
item.description: The models were carefully painted before being placed in a scene of nature where they expertly blended in with their surroundings in a process which takes several hours.

item.title: Putin warns the world not to interfere in Belarus
item.description: The Russian President spoke with the German Chancellor by telephone today following outcry in the West over the dubious election results and the ensuing crackdown by Alexander Lukashenko.

item.title: Sajid Javid lands top role at US investment bank six months after quitting as chancellor
item.description: Sajid Javid will join the European advisory team at JP Morgan, where he will advise clients on the economic landscape in Europe after Brexit.

item.title: Boy who was thrown 100 feet from Tate Modern balcony by Jonty Bravery enjoys first weekend at home
item.description: The French boy was six years old when autistic teenager Jonty Bravery hurled him from the Tate Modern's 100ft viewing platform in London on August 4 last year.

item.title: England's last major mine shuts its doors with thousands of years of coalmining nearing its end
item.description: The Bradley open-cast mine in Durham is extracting its last coal today, after almost 200 years in operation. Owners Banks Group applied to keep the mine until open 2021, but it was denied.
